item.description:
Welcome to the 10th annual Sundays in Patton Park, a FREE outdoor musical concert series in Hamilton, Massachusetts

 

We will be listening to (drum roll please) Don’t Call Me Shirley!  DCMS play’s Classic hits from the 1950's to today's favorites ... from Elvis Presley & Johnny Cash of the 50's to The Beatles & The Stones of the 60's, from The Doobie Brothers & Creedence Clearwater Revival of the 70's to John Mellencamp & Tommy Tutone of the 80's, from Sublime & Bare Naked Ladies of the 90's to Matchbox 20 & Train of the 00's, and they are always adding more songs.  You say you can't dance?  Can you tap your foot?  Sing? Cheer on a great band?  Then come out and join us anyways you will be listening to a great band and enjoying a great night out with great friends!

Seating: They don’t have any chairs so feel free to bring your own blanket and/or chair so you can sit back, enjoy yourself and be comfortable. 

  Picnic: Please bring something to share with the group (if you bring something that needs utensils remember to bring them also).  When you know what you are bringing, let the group know in your RSVP.  Also please bring your own non-alcoholic beverage, so you are drinking what you want.  The organizers will bring plates, napkins and utensils.


Parking: Is available in 2 small designated lots at either end of the park, as well as across the street at the Winthrop Elementary School.

Directions: Go to http://www.pattonparkconcerts.org/ and on the left side of the screen you will see the directions tab.

The weekly concerts are held in the bandstand at Patton Park (located on Rte 1A in Hamilton) on Sunday evenings from 5-7 PM.  In the event of rain, arrangements are made for an inside venue nearby—with the information posted at the park by 3 PM on the day of the concert.  This rain information and directions may also be accessed in a temporary message recorded at 978-468-4818. 

Don’t worry about the bugs!  Experience has shown that they only come out at dusk—after 7 o’clock!  As Patton Park is quite open near the bandstand, do consider the heat and late afternoon sun.  You may wish to bring sun block, hats, and/or other provisions for shade if appropriate.

If you are running late, can’t find us or need to cancel at the last minute, the meetup phone number is:  978-304-2811. 

Please remember that if you have not paid your dues for this year, be prepared to pay them at this event.  If you need to find out if you owe money, please look at your profile page where it states “Membership dues last recorded by your Organizer”, we thank you for paying your dues.

Remember to change your RSVP to an event if your plans change.  Also don’t forget after attending a meetup event to let your Organizers know if you had a good time by rating the meetup.

We look forward to dancing in the park with you!

Donna & Janet
item.how_to_find_us: Look for us on the lawn facing the band!
item.why: We love this band and summer time is the best time for a picnic in the park!
item.name: Let's go on a picnic and listen/dance to DCMS!
